raw_comment:
1)i noticed that families with more income tend  to get higher chances of being accepted into more elite colleges  compared to families with a lower income. along with having a legacy within their family seems to be more of an advantage into being admitted
2)i wonder whether the results would have been different if they didn't have a legacy in their families. And if they would still have been admitted just by having a higher income.
3)this relates to my community since we are in a lower income community because the looks of it can affect our acceptance in some colleges. and the people who have applied to elite colleges may be harder because they don't have the same resources as someone with a higher income may have.
4)money may be the answer to getting into elite colleges
ace_sentences: I noticed that families with higher income tend to have a higher chance of acceptance into elite colleges than families with lower income.
Having a legacy in a family seems to be an advantage for admission to an elite college.
I wonder whether the results would be different if applicants do not have a family legacy.
I wonder whether applicants with higher income would still be admitted if they do not have a family legacy.
My community is a lower-income community.
The lower income of my community can affect acceptance into some colleges.
For people from my community, applying to elite colleges may be harder.
People from my community may not have the same resources as people with higher income.
Money may be the answer to getting into elite colleges.
